title: Function of several complex variables
summary: The theory of functions of several complex variables is the branch of mathematics dealing with complex-valued functions. The name of the field dealing with the properties of function of several complex variables is called several complex variables (and analytic space), that has become a common name for that whole field of study and Mathematics Subject Classification has, as a top-level heading. A function f : ( z 1 , z 2 , … , z n ) → f ( z 1 , z 2 , … , z n ) {\displaystyle f:(z_{1},z_{2},\ldots ,z_{n})\rightarrow f(z_{1},z_{2},\ldots ,z_{n})} is n-tuples of complex numbers, classically studied on the complex coordinate space C n {\displaystyle \mathbb {C} ^{n}} .
